> EDIT: The QML repo has a common commit history with this repo, and, therefore, it can be merged in whenever it is considered useful.

Okay.

And what is your idea about other suggestion @hebasto? 

>4. Adding support for CMake tool as a fast and reliable tool. Build with CMake. Build with Confidence (CMake slogan!). It helps us to provide fast and synchronized output on target platforms.
>5. Upgrading Interface codes to Qt6 and also core codes to C++20 in the future as a goal.
>6. It is important for me to pay attention to the support of new technologies such as web assembly (WASM).

> And what is your idea about other suggestion @hebasto?
> 
> > 4. Adding support for CMake tool as a fast and reliable tool. Build with CMake. Build with Confidence (CMake slogan!). It helps us to provide fast and synchronized output on target platforms.

Our build system, which is based on the Autotools, works just fine. There should be very compelling reasons to move from Autotools to CMake.

> > 5. Upgrading Interface codes to Qt6 and also core codes to C++20 in the future as a goal.

Yes, in the future. Also see #23363.

> > 6. It is important for me to pay attention to the support of new technologies such as web assembly (WASM).

I know nothing about WASM.

Thanks, however I don't think there's much value in keeping this issue open. It's a collection of generic points/improvements, most of which are already being worked on, or which have their own tracking issues.
